intro: Rhynchospora schiedeana subsp. varica, commonly known as the variable spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, preferring moist to aquatic habitats. Its morphology includes slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. The subspecies is notable for its variability in leaf shape and flowering structures, which may contribute to its adaptability in different wetland environments.
